newsitem.title: CANADA: Domco approves C$53 mln offering prospectus.
newsitem.headline: Domco approves C$53 mln offering prospectus.

text.p: Domco Inc said on Thursday it approved the filing of a preliminary prospectus in Canada for a C$53 million treasury and secondary offering of common shares.
Domco said the treasury portion of the issue, expected to be about C$35 million, will be used to reduce long-term debt.

Repayment, together with cash flow from operations, will provide Domco with the financial flexibility to spend about C$33 million over the next two years to automate certain production processes, improve productivity and increase capacity in all of its production facilities.
Domco said US$9.9 million will be used to purchase the remaining 7.4 percent non-controlling interest in Domco USA Inc, which holds the company's interests in its U.S.-based operations.

Two European shareholders, Linor SA and Sergio Serralunga, will sell about 1.6 million common shares as part of the offering, Domco said. Linor will hold about four percent of the common shares of Domco after the offering.

Domco said its principal shareholder, Sommer Allibert, is not selling any shares in the offering. Sommer's equity interest in Domco, which currently stands at 80.2 percent, will decline to 66 percent after giving effect to the offering.
